alert.note: Alert for Duplin; Lenoir (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 31 at 9:03AM EDT until August 31 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Duplin County in eastern North Carolina... Lenoir County in eastern North Carolina... * Until 1100 AM EDT. * At 903 AM EDT, 911 Center reported heavy rain across the warned area has closed several roads around Lenoir County. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kinston, La Grange, Mount Olive, Grifton, Kornegay, Deep Run, Beautancus, Institute, Dawson, Graingers, Albertson, Kinston Regional Jetport, Faison, Pink Hill, Calypso and Sandy Bottom. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
